author.name: Michel Lara
author.description: Father & Husband-Advocate for Liberty- Classicist aficionado-History/ Art/ Literature. Book collector- philosopher-poet

html: The Allure of Ancient Ruins \n\nWhen we contemplate a broken Delphic column, we're witnessing a memorial to the brevity of human endeavors. Yet its marbled silence that seems so lifeless is indeed inhabited by a meaning that transcends us all. https://t.co/Qf8aorrSuI

author.description: A Knowledge Curation Platform. We index, rank, and review tens of thousands of newly published pieces across text, audio, and video. Subscribe ⬇️

html:
The world's first mass-smoking society was, in fact, one of the first to condemn cigarettes. Our Book of the Week examines how smoking developed and grew in the USSR despite the absence of mass production or intensive advertising.

By @tricia_starks

https://t.co/WAKQIbS18r

html:
What stories about empire do everyday objects tell? How can everyday objects today be placed into dialogue with 19th-century collections? 

By Alison Solomon for @unibirmingham 

https://t.co/Lo3rdGzJiE

author.name: Codex OS

html:
One sentence by John Milton contains an entire essay.

It is breathtaking.

A sentence by Milton sports like a blue whale on the ocean while those of other writers flap on the shore like gasping fish. https://t.co/5ZKPjcJh0t

author.name: Codex OS

html: A Milton sentence is a landscape painting ... https://t.co/jD74ZHixn4

author.name: Archaeo - Histories
author.description: History is an unending dialogue between present and the past, that's why few pages of history give more insight than all the metaphysical volumes.

html:
Then vs Now :

Ancient theater at archaeological site of Delphi, Greece. Site offered audience a wonderful view with entire shelter and view of olive valley above. Dating back to 4 Centuries BC, theater was built from limestone of Parnassos Mountain.

#archaeohistories https://t.co/Emu8asMh8q

html:
The volumetric geopolitics of burial shows how embodied experiences and practices of interment illuminate specific class-based death cultures and economies through intimate and affective ecologies of governance.

By @ccameronbyron in @RSA_TPG

https://t.co/PWF3kuyC68

author.name: Jens Notroff
author.description: #Archaeologist, got a hat (no whip though). Once known as "Yunus" among Bedouins. Demanding a revival of the venerable profession of the #ExpeditionPainter.

html:
Narrator: How they'd move such monuments remains a mystery forever. ☝️🧐

Ancient Egyptians: These? Pushed them here. 😏

Narrator: Not a trace of how they could have done this. 🤷🏻‍♂️

Ancient Egyptians: Haha. Pushing and pulling. 💪

Narrator: Baffling. 🤯

Ancient Egyptians: 🤨 https://t.co/wDdueTKwyt
